numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young women reach out to their parents more often than young men.
2. Less than 25 percent of young men visit their parents in person at least once a day or a few times a week.
3. Less than 25 percent of young women visit their parents in person at least once a day or a few times a week.
4. Text messages and phone calls are more accessible ways of connection than in-person visits.
5. Text messages and phone calls show a greater divide between young men and young women in interaction with their parents.
6. I wonder whether traditional gender stereotypes affect how often a young person reaches out to the parents of the young person.
7. Society typically encourages young men to be independent.
8. Society typically encourages young men to not ask for help often.
9. Society expects women to lead domestic lives.
10. Society expects women to lead family-centric lives.
11. I ask whether this phenomenon has deeper roots.
12. I ask whether biological instincts are unique to each gender.
13. I have a very close relationship with my parents.
14. I am an only child.
15. I am an only daughter.
16. Many family friends of mine are adults.
17. Many family friends of mine have only boys as children.
18. Some family friends of mine call me an honorary daughter.
19. People frequently mention that I reach out to them more than their boys reach out to them.
20. People frequently say that parenting a girl is very different.
